See #15371.

---

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [38e9b440a4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15417/commits/38e9b440a41973bd8bef8437eaab27653956c165)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

bors r+
Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10249569849/job/28353247172)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10249569849/job/28353247664)
Thanks!
Thanks for the careful review. That is exactly the feedback I was looking for! I have addressed all comments.

```suggestion
```
There is no other change in the file, so this shouldn't be needed.
The proof requires `classical`, but that was already present --- reverted.
I don't understand: in the current version, `classical` is still there, and can be removed. Did you forget to push?
Yes, I did! (I stashed those change temporarily, and forgot to pop my stash.) Added now.

```suggestion
```

Better use `classical` in the proof, if it is not  needed for the statement, like:
```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem integral_neg : integral I l (-f) vol = -integral I l f vol := by
  classical
  exact if h : Integrable I l f vol then h.hasIntegral.neg.integral_eq
```
When the decidability assumption is used for the left hand side of the equality in the theorem, can you instead add a decidability assumption?
ditto
ditto
just use one `classical`, at the beginning of the proof?
ditto (here and below)
This one looks wrong: if `classical` is allowed, there is no need to unfold anything, and the instance doesn't make sense. Instead, could you add suitable decidability assumptions for the instance?
Good catch! I'm not sure what a suitable decidability assumption is... I have used `open Classical in` for now (which is less wrong, but perhaps not "right" yet).
Maybe add a comment with a TODO?
Done

```suggestion
```
use decidability assumptions?
I added them - this makes the proofs require `convert rfl`, though.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: remove some open Classical, part 3
